meanings.definition: The plural form of the word 'cero', meaning zero or nothing.
meanings.sent1: In the game, I rolled two ceros on the dice, which means I got nothing.
meanings.sent2: The bank account showed multiple ceros, indicating a balance of zero dollars.
meanings.sent3: When asked how many cookies were left, Tim jokingly replied, 'There are ceros left!'
meanings.sent4: Her excitement turned to disappointment when she saw the ceros on her exam paper.
meanings.sent5: The field was covered in ceros of snow, creating a serene white landscape.

meanings.definition: A type of deer native to South America.
meanings.sent1: During the safari, we spotted a group of ceros grazing peacefully in the meadow.
meanings.sent2: The ceros moved gracefully through the forest, blending in with the trees.
meanings.sent3: The children were delighted to see the ceros at the zoo, mistaking them for reindeer.
meanings.sent4: The majestic ceros symbolized the beauty of the South American wilderness.
meanings.sent5: The ceros' antlers stood out against the lush greenery of the rainforest.
